result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M. Trempe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: federal probation defendant is currently serving

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment and counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and illegal drugs.

Assessment and counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
1 day jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason M. Trempe

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:32 am 
INCLUDES 15CF104 AND 15CF264.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Richard Lawson.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW. 

State moves to:
In 15CF104: Ct. 1 (Felony Retail Theft/Repeater)>>AMEND TO Misd. Retail Theft/Repeater pursuant to 943.50(1m)(b)(4)(a). 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF264: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF104: Amended Ct. 1 (Misd. Retail Theft/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF264: Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation to run concurrent to federal probation def is currently serving - CONDITIONS: assessment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; absolute sobriety from alcohol and illegal drugs; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 1 day jail credit in 15CF264 if revoked. 

Adj: 11:43 am
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called:  10:40 am  
Clerk: Kim H.
15CF104 and 15CF264
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in person/pro se.  Date and time for Preliminary Hearing.  State informs Court defendant is requesting Indigency Hearing.  COURT questions defendant.  Defendant states he is under federal jurisdiction.  COURT finds indigent and requests that he go to public defender's office.  COURT appoints Atty Richard Lawson at $70.00 per hr/caps at $1,400.00 (may request to raise cap), and defendant to repay at $50.00 per wk.  Defendant to see payment officer after court.  Defendant to call if Atty Lawson is not needed.  COURT addressed time limits.  Atty Mayo states times limits already waived on 15CF264.  COURT questions dft regarding 15CF104.  Defendant waives TL on 15CF104.
Next court date:  CC 4/28/15 at 1:00 pm in Br 2 office
Adj.  10:46 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Includes 15CF104 and 15CF264.  No contact with victim(s): Schofield Hobby, R.P.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.     Shall not consume alcohol.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 (drugs/alcohol) with day reporting.
